attributes.action: Create a campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background: The number of young people being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes is rising at an alarming rate. The symptoms are often missed or explained away as flu. If left undiagnosed the outcome is fatal. If diagnosis is delayed the result is life changing. We need a campaign to highlight the symptoms.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.news-medical.net/news/2007/03/19/22619.aspx

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/About_us/News_Landing_Page/UK-has-worlds-5th-highest-rate-of-Type-1-diabetes-in-children/

The statistics are frightening.
We need to raise awareness of the symptoms like we have had with meningitis and more recently sepsis.

attributes.action: All jurors in rape trials to complete compulsory training about rape myths
attributes.background: Research shows that jurors accept commonly held rape myths resulting in many incorrect not guilty verdicts. Rapists are walking free from court, although evidence is robust. This ruins lives. Rape conviction in the UK is very low. Compared to other crimes conviction is 21% lower.
attributes.additional_details: Research by Rape Crisis & Alison Saunders, Director of Public Prosecutions, finds that jurors often accept rape myths & thus acquit rapists who are in fact guilty. 66% of jurors do not understand judges' legal directions which attempt to dispel rape myths, but fail. Jurors need proper rape myth training prior to & throughout trials. Info: https://rapecrisis.org.uk/mythsvsrealities.php https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape_myth  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-39182779

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory training in autism for all NHS mental health services.
attributes.background:
1 in 68 people has an ASC. 
Over 50% of autistic people have depression. 
They are 28 times more likely to exhibit suicidal thoughts/behaviours. 
There is difficultly in accessing support, and staff are insufficiently trained. According to NAS, Transforming Care implementation needs improvement.
attributes.additional_details:
Because of the additional need for support, all mental health services are guaranteed to treat some autistic patients. However, many staff have no training in this whatsoever.   

Even basic training would have an immediate impact on helping autistic people engage with services effectively. 

Inpatient mental health care should be viewed as our last line of defence. Therefore it is imperative that these staff have, at minimum, a basic understanding of autism spectrum conditions.

attributes.action: Increase security at unmanned train stations to prevent suicide
attributes.background: All unmanned train stations should have security gates and CCTV that captures motion. No passengers should be allowed onto the platform until the train has stopped. People getting off trains should be monitored to make sure they leave the station. This would help to prevent suicide and accidents.
attributes.additional_details: My son Oscar Phillips took his own life aged just 16, with no history or signs of any mental illness. Oscar one day took himself to our local station and never came back. A lonely unmanned station, with 80mph trains passing, but no restrictions on public access.

attributes.action: Stop Botox & Dermal fillers on minors by making it illegal for those under 18
attributes.background: Cosmetic doctors, nurses, dentists and surgeons have been calling for tougher regulations for injectables. In the UK, it’s almost entirely unregulated with no minimum age for those seeking out Botox or dermal fillers.
attributes.additional_details: Without enforcement of any laws there has been an increase in botched treatments, some of which have been very dangerous, leaving the vulnerable millennial generation at most risk.

attributes.action: Make Sanitary Wear free on prescription for girls under 16 and women on benefits
attributes.background:
sanitary wear should be made freely available to those entitled to free prescriptions, namely women on low incomes, girls under the age of 16 and homeless women
women will use on average 11,000 items in her lifetime, for those who suffer with gynaecological conditions this will be higher.
attributes.additional_details: Along with the health risks associated with not having appropriate menstrual support, it is now more frequently affecting women at work and the education of girls as many will remain at home due to the inability to purchase the necessary items.– many of these staff are on low incomes themselves – this in itself can cause financial difficulties. It is also impacting on staff in schools as they are often purchasing these items to ensure that girls do not take time out of the classroom.
attributes.creator_name: Sarah James - GMB Union BOSS group

attributes.action: All high-rise tower blocks over 30 metres must have sprinklers installed.
attributes.background: Sprinklers save the lives of tower block residents and firefighters. Lives could have been saved in the fatal fires at Grenfell Tower and Lakanal House in London, and at Shirley Towers in Southampton. The new law should include a duty on local authorities and the local fire service to enforce.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2013, the Coroner of the Shirley Towers fire recommended that:
"Social housing providers should be encouraged to consider the retrofitting of sprinklers in all existing high-rise buildings in excess of 30 metres in height." Fire experts recommend sprinklers too. Yet in all this time, seven years after Shirley Towers, councils and housing providers have failed to install sprinklers. We should not wait for the Grenfell Tower investigations to complete. The law must change NOW.

attributes.action: Change what DWP are allowed to take off your Benefits from 40% to maximum 20%
attributes.background: At the moment for a single adult claimant of Universal Credit the law states we can live on £317.82 but can take 40% (£127) of this to pay off likes of budget loans or rent arrears etc leaving someone with very little to live on after bills & food
attributes.additional_details:
£317.82 is for a single person over 25yr old as stated here: https://www.gov.uk/universal-credit/what-youll-get

Now for someone only on Universal Credit that £127 a month reduction can cause serious hardship. Please help us to get this amount reduced to a more manageable amount such as £31 (10%) or £63 (20) at the most.

Universal Credit as many of you are aware is the new blanket benefit for anyone whether unemployed part time worker or disabled.

attributes.action: To reform outdated English marriage law, which is no longer ‘Fit For Purpose’
attributes.background:
We need to reform the Marriage Act 1949 as it is 70 years out of date. 

Make it compulsory for every faith to register marriages, not just 3 faiths (Anglicans, Jews and Quakers). 

100,000s have no legal rights in an unregistered religious marriage and this figure is rising yearly.
attributes.additional_details:
Religious marriages conducted abroad are legally recognised, but UK religious marriages are not. The result? Chaos, injustice and discrimination:

- Overnight homelessness, destitution
- lost savings invested in ‘matrimonial’ home 
- No Pension or Inheritance rights
- Men, women and children suffer

There are no Cohabitation rights - and these couples face a double handicap as they thought they were married.

In the 21st century, a fair and equal marriage law needs to cover all faiths.

attributes.action: Oblige employers to give paid leave for parents of kids with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: Parents of children with chronic illnesses (e.g. juvenile idiopathic arthritis or juvenile diabetes) need time off work for frequent medical appointments, meaning parents often lose their jobs or cannot continue to work, leading to hardship.  The law should provide for permitted, paid time off.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all new building developments incorporate solar panels
attributes.background: There is a requirement for alternative energy, and given the number of new houses required moving forward, this would be an ideal strategy to help alleviate the use of fossil and nuclear energy.
attributes.additional_details: It would also be easier to connect to the national grid at the build stage rather than having to retro-fit at a later stage. it would also help increase the solar power industry.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background:
The House of Lords is meant to be a revising chamber for Government legislation. It is currently bursting at the seams with unelected peers who claim expenses and do not vote. 115 peers claimed £1.3m in expenses but scarcely uttered a word or voted.
Replace the House with an elected upper chamber.
attributes.additional_details:
It is time for elections to the House of Lords.
Elect people from different backgrounds and experience to represent the people and truly hold Parliament to account.

attributes.action: Regulate the eyelash extension industry making training compulsory
attributes.background: Let’s make our lash industry safe, by regulating it we avoid non trained individuals to practice without a license. This would minimise the risks of lash and eye damage

attributes.action: Stop the setting of homework for children until the age of 14 in the UK.
attributes.background:
Homework is killing our children’s love of learning.

We need to remove the unnecessary pressure and stress of homework.  We need to liberate our children to enjoy the fun and freedom in life.
attributes.additional_details: I do believe that work beyond the classroom becomes relevant and important as children embark on their GCSE and A Levels.  I also believe that there is an argument for determined practice but this needs to be driven from within and a desire to learn and succeed; not a product of relentless persuasion from a parent.   Unfortunately, by the time children reach GCSE, homework has become an arduous task with little meaning or benefit.  It is purely a task which has to be endured; there is no investment or passion.

attributes.action: Outlaw the inhumane slaughter of fish in commercial and non-commercial fishing
attributes.background: Fish are by far the UK's greatest victims of animal abuse as 800,000 suffer the following fates every day. Common methods of fish slaughter are cutting/filleting alive (fish remain conscious for 25-65 more mins) and suffocation (takes 55-250 minutes of complete agony). There are humane alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
Most reputable marine biologists, at major centers (including experts at the University of Cambridge and multiple national centres of marine life studies), now believe that fish can feel pain in as many ways that we do and that they are MUCH smarter than we previously thought. With that in mind, both non-commercial and commercial fisherman almost always use inhumane, prolonged methods of slaughter. 
Sources:  humane slaughter by fish count.org.uk.  Do Fish Feel Pain? by Jonathan Balcombe/PBS.

attributes.action: Teach pupils to check themselves as part of sex education to prevent cancer
attributes.background: At 29 years old, Simone Ferman, mother of two from Essex was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. The lump was discovered by her partner - Simone never checked herself as she didn't know how to. If pupils were taught this as part of sex education in schools, it could save thousands of lives.
attributes.additional_details: If you have a sore throat, you go to the doctor and get medicine. If you find a lump, you go and get it checked - Yes? Wrong! Most people don't get it checked as they don't know they have a lump and then it's too late. There are millions of men and women who don't check themselves as they don't know how. We need to raise awareness as if a lump is cancerous and caught early, there is a very high survival rate. Pupils therefore need to be taught in school, as part of sex education, how to check.

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave compulsory and paid
attributes.background: Make compassionate leave for close family members (parents, children, siblings, partners, in-laws and grandparents) compulsory for companies to recognize, and for the leave to be paid so the surviving family member is not left shortpaid due to the relatives death.
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2017, both of my grandfathers passed away. My company did not grant compassionate leave either time, giving me the only option to take it as unpaid sick leave. This pushed me into financial difficulty which I have yet to come out of, playing catch up each month. 

My cousin had the same situation, having to take annual leave on the day of our grandfathers death.

Family members dying is hard enough to deal with emotionally, the worker should not be affected financially as well.

attributes.action: Fairer road fund licence rates for motorcycles.
attributes.background: HMRC allows 24p per mile for business use on motorcycles yet allows 45p per mile for cars, it therefore seems unfair that motorcycles can pay considerably more in road fund licence than cars with similar emissions, they should be encouraged to be part of an integrated traffic solution not penalised.
attributes.additional_details: Motorcycles take up less space on our overcrowded roads, don't usually get held up in traffic and take up far less space when parked, as a result they will usually pollute less than most cars, yet motorcycles pay road fund licences based purely on engine size.  This means that modern, low emission machines can be paying £85 per year compared to zero for similarly poluting cars.  We therefore call on the government to reduce the road fund licences on all motorcycles.

attributes.action: Create a devolved Yorkshire Assembly with powers equal to the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to create a devolved legislative and executive body representing the traditional county of Yorkshire which will have powers equal to that of the Welsh Assembly, overseeing local matters such as housing; the environment; health services and flood defences.

attributes.action: Suspend UK training the Burmese Armed Forces.
attributes.background: In 2017 the Burmese Armed Forces did something called Ethnic Cleansing to the Rohingya Muslims. Ethnic Cleansing is when they remove an ethnicity from their territory. It comes in forms like deportation and, in severe cases, mass murder and genocidal rape. Last year UK funded the Burma Army £305K.
attributes.additional_details: So far the Armed Forces have killed more than 1000 Muslims and 200,000 Muslims have been displaced from their homes and fled to other countries. They have also raped some women and have burnt people's homes. We the people paid the government so that they can make good use of it. We want them to stop funding the Burmese Armed Forces because of the actions they have done to the Muslims. Imagine if you were a 5yr old innocent child, you had fled to Bangladesh and your family had recently died. So please take action in Myanmar.

attributes.action: Make every workplace and school complete a mandatory yearly CPR training day.
attributes.background: Many people don't know how to perform a life saving procedure (CPR) due to no fault of their own, but due to their school or work areas not providing this training. I believe more lives will be saved if CPR training is an mandatory training session. I know many people would appreciate this training.

attributes.action: To make every person who works driving HGV in this country pass a UK HGV test
attributes.background: This will make sure that the industry's standards are the same throughout  and drivers have a good sound knowledge of UK Driving rules and regulations before they can be employed as an HGV driver in the UK.

attributes.action: Withdraw Universal Jobmatch in its current form.
attributes.background:
Job Seekers are constantly being illegally pressured into opening/using Universal Jobmatch - despite the fact many Job Seekers do not trust it. In addition, many Job Search Providers do not trust Universal Jobmatch either!

Simple changes to the design of Universal Jobmatch can aleviate this:
attributes.additional_details:
Universal Jobmatch (UJ) is not fit for the purpose for which it was designed: it needs a thorough re-design so that employers cannot post vacancies anonymously - 33% of all vacancies posted on Universal Jobmatch do not exist at all!

Full name and address details for all vacancies must be included, along with a link to the employers' details on the Companies House website - where a role is advertised by an Agency, these details must be those of the Client.

Simple changes that can improve UJ!

attributes.action: Give all British Gibraltarian citizens the right to vote and a dedicated MP
attributes.background: About 33,000 British Gibraltarian citizens living in European British Gibraltar do not have the right to vote in UK General Elections. They therefore lack representation in Parliament. Although British Gibraltarian Citizens voted in EU referendum, they are not eligible to vote in UK Gen. Elections.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that all British Gibraltarian citizens deserve genuine representation in Parliament. British Gibraltarian citizens must be able to vote for an MP to represent their interests in the House of Commons. Having their own dedicated MPs would more efficiently address their concerns which are often different to UK residents’. This petition proposes to assist British Gibraltarians express their views in Brexit negotiations and enable parliament to explicitly know their demands and concerns.

attributes.action: Allow Special Constables the ability to be awarded the QPM outside of Scotland.
attributes.background: Formed in 1831 the Special Constabulary pre-dates the modern police service as a voluntary police service in the United Kingdom, in modern times the Special Constabulary patrol side by side with paid Police Officers undertaking the same duties and tasks but on a voluntary basis.
attributes.additional_details: The Queens Police Medal which can be awarded to Police Officers for distinguished service, currently however it is only in Scotland that Specials are eligible to be nominated for this award, this petition seeks to address this in-balance and permit voluntary police officers throughout the whole of the United Kingdom the same right in their eligibility for the QPM award.  The Special Constabulary give tens of thousands of hours to the protecting our communities each year as vital part of policing

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
In 2014 the public sector spent 140 million on translation services; 2017 will be considerably more.
Local councils spent at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spent more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS – a conservative estimate was £55m.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.

There are far too many foreign nationals settled in the UK long term that do not or refuse to integrate fully into our society by not learning to read and write in our native languages.

Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Eradicate the loophole that allows railway stations to be closed by stealth
attributes.background: Closure of a railway station is a serious blow to the community it serves. It deprives it of valuable transport links, and makes it much more difficult to get to and from. However, all over the country stations are being "closed by stealth" with little or any consultation of the people affected.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent example: Pilning (S Glos) - Footbridge to one platform demolished, sneaked through under the guise of a "minor modification". Now served by two trains a week in one direction only. 

We ask the Secretary of State for Transport to take the necessary steps to stop this cynical abuse of the system. Please remove the loophole that allows to close any part of a station without a proper public consultation. Make a full consultation compulsory when the change affects any passenger services.

attributes.action: No Clock Changes: Maintain British Summer Time through the year
attributes.background: Changing clocks twice a year is a stupid, inefficient and outdated practice.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland could have its own separate time if it needs to.

attributes.action: Halt Taunton Deane District Council taking over West Somerset District Council.
attributes.background: The obliteration of West Somerset Council will reduce electoral its representation, will centralise services in the more prosperous and more urbanised Taunton Deane and distance people in West Somerset from the delivery of services by making those delivering the services less accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed merger was based on a deficit accumulated by West Somerset. The deficit, that is forecast to drop dramatically, is not surprising given West Somerset's relative deprivation and the unfair distribution of the rural grant that pays a city like Bristol more per head in than the deeply rural and under populated West Somerset.

Construction of Hinkley C nuclear power station and the government's policy of local councils retaining business rates will change the fortunes of West Somerset.

attributes.action: Abolish Mobile Speed Cameras
attributes.background: The use of mobile speed cameras is increasing generating masses of revenue for local authorities. Current tactics used to target drivers on the roads when going about their daily business is wrong, has a negative impact on lives and contributes only a small percentage to road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
These days it’s easy to speed in modern cars & the police know it so when traveling to work one day in a safe manner they’ll be waiting for you tucked in on some layby.

Law abiding citizens caught by these mobile speed traps feel they’ve been deliberately targeted & criminalised by the organisation set out to protect is in for gain. Millions of drivers fined for speeding over the years have seen nothing in return and whilst this continues what improvements have we seen from all these fines?

attributes.action: Stop Anti-abortion Life charity from getting £250k from from UK tampon tax.
attributes.background: The government has confirmed that it is to award a quarter of a million pounds from an unpopular levy on women’s sanitary products to an anti-abortion organisation, despite objections from women’s groups and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/28/anti-abortion-life-charity-will-get--tampon-tax-funds

attributes.action: Ensure there's a legal entitlement to contact with siblings and half-siblings
attributes.background:
Individuals should be entitled to contact with their siblings (including 'half-' and step-siblings) under 18, unless the courts deem that there is reasonable concern this would have a negative impact on the child's welfare. 
As the law currently stands, there's no rights of access for siblings.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'nuclear family model' (a father, mother and their children) is no longer representative of the family dynamics within the UK.  
Therefore, we hope a law will be put in place to ensure siblings are entitled to contact with each other, as the law does not currently serve to protect that special, intimate bond they share. If the parent with custody decided to stop access to the other parent, the siblings suffer consequently - being unable to see each other.

attributes.action: Use the Tampon Tax to subsidise sanitary products for girls of school age
attributes.background:
We believe the money gained through the tampon tax should be used for Period related issues.
Children of school age currently receive:
Free school meals
Free prescriptions
Free or subsided transport
Free contraception
We believe that sanitary wear should be added to this list.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39266056

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/girls-skipping-school-periods-cant-afford-tampons-sanitary-pads-a7629766.html

Periodicaldiary.com

attributes.action: Halve Tuition Fees, & bring back Maintenance Grants for all University students.
attributes.background: Universities are institutions of education, where students across the UK develop knowledge and skills. Yet, over recent years, the fees have been dramatically increased for reasons no Minister can explain. Each year, thousands of students fail to apply due to the cost. These fees must be reduced.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, if a UK student wishes to study at ANY university, for ANY course, they must pay £9,250 a YEAR, over their course length. Additionally, all students have a maintenance loan, which again, needs to be repaid. This eventually leaves many students with a debt of around £51,000 at the age of 21. This means that as soon as they enter work, that debt needs repaying. This petition would decrease student debt from around £51,000 over a lifetime to around £13,800, which is a vast improvement.

attributes.action: Ban all trade of Ivory in the UK with NO exceptions!
attributes.background: Elephants’ biggest threat is the trade in their ivory tusks. The UK has become the world’s leading exporter in ivory in recent years. The newly proposed ban contains exceptions, including musical Instruments and items of "cultural importance". The ban should be TOTAL, with no exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: For more information search for "The Truth Behind Your Ivory Trinkets" on YouTube. This video shows the brutal process by which ivory is harvested and contains more information about the ivory trade. Please watch.

attributes.action: Close anticlock sliproad M25 junction 1b to stop drivers cutting from junction 2
attributes.background: The anticlockwise slip road at junction 1b is used as cut through when the M25 traffic is bad. This then blocks the flow of traffic in and around Dartford resulting in major conjestion and air/noise pollution in the local area.
attributes.additional_details: The local authority have stated that they cannot install or police a box junction. If a box junction was to be installed it will likely be ignored anyway. Access to the M25 could be maintained via the junction and roundabouts at junction 2

attributes.action: Provide dedicated child bereavement teams to families after the death of a child
attributes.background:
After losing 2 children within 2 1/2 years my family was offered no support either during or after our hospital stay. We left the hospital with a pamphlet, a box and a broken heart.
Families are left to scour google for hours in the hope of finding support and it's just not good enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Today 17 babies will die, and these families wont have a clue where to turn as they begin their grieving process.
It is often left down to each family to source their own support at a time when they're at their most emotionally vulnerable.
There should be dedicated teams of professionals who can support families before, during and after the loss of their child for as long as necessary and it should be mandatory that these teams are in place and active in each case as soon as the need arises.

attributes.action: Allow women to carry pepper sprays for self defence.
attributes.background:
It's unfortunate that we we are witnessing the rise of crime especially in the last year. It is also common sense to acknowledge that women are in a higher risk to be victims of all crimes especially ones of sexual nature.
As crime is skyrocketing protecting ourselves is an obligation.
attributes.additional_details: The Office of National Statistics state that the total number of crimes reported by police arose by 10% between April 2016 and March 2017 -a total of almost 5 million crimes. Violent crimes arose by 18%, robberies by 16%, sex offences by 14% and knife crimes by 20%. Women are more likely to experience all kind of violence and 5 times as likely to experience sexual attacks.The number of rapes recorded by police has doubled in the last 4 years. The figures are worrying and women feel insecure.

attributes.action: Create a bank holiday to celebrate the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle
attributes.background: Today a spokesperson for the Prime Minister stated there was no intention of holding a bank holiday. People should be allowed to rejoice in the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle. There is precedent for this. A bank holiday was granted for the marriage of The Duke & Duchess of Cambridge.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: I feel as everything else is going up like smoking/drinking and this shouldn't be any different also it would reduce voting fraud.

attributes.action: Make specialist training a requirement for licensing of zoos with exotic animals
attributes.background: Currently, there are no legal requirements for a person to have gained any formal training to be awarded a licence for a zoo or sanctuary that contains exotic animals. Through the lack of expertise and knowledge this leads to the maltreatment of animals in captivity.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of specialist training leads to the maltreatment and fatality of exotic animals and risk to both public and staff. The recent death of two large cats - one which was asphyxiated during incompetent handling and the other which escaped and was euthanised when deemed to be a threat to the public - could have been avoided had appropriate training been required of the operators. Other cases of neglect of exotic animals at licensed establishments have been made public, as have deaths of handlers

attributes.action: Government to provide mental health screening for all new fathers.
attributes.background: While new mothers have screening for their mental health, unfortunately fathers who also have a history if depression do not at present. With all recent research on Fathers we must provide an assessment for all parents as the biggest killer in men under fifty in the UK is SUICIDE.

attributes.action: Fund a veterans' bus pass for all veterans
attributes.background: The Government should demonstrate its gratitude for what all the Veterans have done for this Country so this is why I would like to start this petition.

attributes.action: A life sentence should mean there can never be the chance of parole.
attributes.background: A life sentence should mean just that. There should be no chance of parole. The sentencing guidelines need to be changed so that life means life. Whole life tariffs for the most heinous crimes should be mandatory. Life should mean Life.

attributes.action: When a defendant makes a plea in a sexual case, the jury should be made aware
attributes.background: Three girls were raped. When the case went to Crown Court, the rapist offered to plead guilty saying that he used his fingers and not his private part. The girls rejected the plea and, to the horror of all 13 witnesses, he was found not guilty. The jury should have known he offered a guilty plea.
attributes.additional_details: In future, when a defendant makes a plea in a case of sexual violence, the jury should be told

attributes.action: Extend the 16-19 transport bursary to pupils placed in an Independent setting.
attributes.background: This bursary is supposed to enable pupils from families on a low income to access education and/ or training by meeting transport costs. The eligibility assumes pupils are not in Independent settings, but local authorities who cannot provide for some with additional needs often use such placements.
attributes.additional_details: The result is that families on a low income with children who have additional needs are financially discriminated against. Often the reason many families with a child who has additional needs are on a low income is due to the care needs of that child.

attributes.action: Delay the sale of RBS until the taxpayer has made a profit on the bailout
attributes.background: The government bought a 72% stake in RBS after the Financial crisis and has kept it in public ownership whilst it was posting losses. This year it finally posted a healthy profit, so the Tories have decided to sell it. We will be making a £26 billion loss on this purchase.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ft.com/content/555bfe08-cf99-11e7-9dbb-291a884dd8c6

attributes.action: Make Student Nurses and Midwives eligible for 30 hours free childcare
attributes.background: Earlier in the year, the government introduced 30 hours of free childcare for 3-4 year olds in the UK. It has since emerged that this scheme ignores the workforce of Student Nurses and Midwives with children who work 30+ hours in the NHS, who are now without a bursary and have limited support.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Student Nurse and Midwifery applications fell by a staggering 23% after the abolition of NHS Bursaries. These students now need to take out loans and take up second jobs in order to make ends meet. This is even harder for students with children and often forces them to drop out after the first year of training.
There are 24,000 nursing posts in the UK which need filling. This is a change that could benefit thousands of Student Nurses and Midwives, and help fill those vacancies.

attributes.action: Stop the CUTS to our armed forces.
attributes.background: The MOD have announced that our armed forces will be cut over the next few years. If this happens it means our Navy, Army and Air Force won't be able to defend this country by conventional means, and would have to rely on our nuclear capabilities instead.

attributes.action: Make it the law for children's feelings and wishes to be heard in family court
attributes.background: I want it to be the law that children can voice what they want to happen in family court, in person, by a voice recorded clip to be played or a letter to be read by the judge. Too many children are not being heard, it time to give them a voice.
